title: @Riot What does Runeterra look like?
body: This is the best image of Runeterra I can find, but I am hoping to find one without the pages overtop of it. Does anyone know of a location, video, or something else where I can find just a single map of Runeterra?

replies.body:
Someone made a map of Runeterra that looks good and is relatively accurate. It's not an official Riot map, but it's accurate based on what we currently know on Runeterra.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/KsAApOMw-lol-wolrd-map-upgraded
I would use it until we get a legitimate map of Runeterra from Rito.
Ahhh, I see. Even the rioter Bio states that there isn't an official Riot Runeterra map yet. Mk. Welp, there goes that idea. May have to use something else then. Thanks!

There's been lore-style in-game competitions like this before, and I'd be interested in joining this one. Sadly, I'm a filthy bronzie and I doubt any team would pick me up.

That's not how it works. On my stream, anyone of any rank can play. First come first serve. Usually it's something like one bronze/unranked, two silvers, a gold, a plat, and a diamond on both teams. Sometimes on teams smashes. Sometimes it's SUPER close. But we've had bronzes literally win the game for their team (An ashe that couldn't miss with her ult, literally slammed like 12 across map ults and won the game singlehandedly) and had silvers make god-like outplays. That's the point of the stream. Bring the LCS experience to everyone.

So for Runeterra Rivalries, you would just volunteer to play for a team a week in advance, then be online for the game, and I invite you. That simple. First come first serve.

Every Tuesday is just free games for anyone. You just show up, ask to play, get invited, and have fun. Myself and my duocaster cast the game and hype it like the LCS, and have a grand old time! They're custom games, so no fear of losing rank, losing stats, which makes winning and losing a secondary condition to having fun and playing awesomely. Even though I believe my stream is still in it's beta stages (trust me, I've only scratched the surface of what I want to do with it), I'm happy to give you a link since you're still interested. I just don't want to be a spammy streamer who tries to garner random follows to boost their ego. My goal is a friendly, fun, and inviting community, not another salty and cussing streamer. We already have plenty of those. ^^

http://www.twitch.tv/jake_kelton/ 
If you want to come hang out on Tuesday. Again, stream is still Beta-mode (which is why I don't advertise), but we're glad to have you!

Again, I talk too much, sorry for long posts. XD

Well there are three other maps, but they're not Runeterra as a whole. 

The other three maps arent the best for _accurate_ geological representation. The Freljord one from years ago could be retconed under certain circumstances (but who knows for sure yet), the Shurima one is ambiguous and unreadable, and the Shadow Isles/ Blue Flame Isles map is more of a visual timeline rather than a proper map.

If you cant find anything else, its because nothing else (that's official) exists yet.
Any links? Or do I just google it? Just not sure what I am looking for.

You can find them from the wiki but google search is easy enough. But I cant stress enough how usless the other three maps are, they're not very detailed or descriptive like the map you did find.

Although the written lore is fairly  descriptive about where all of the most major countries are located from one another. So I dont think its that complicated to conceptualize the basic layout of Runeterra. 

The wiki has a list of its own that documents every location, geological landmark and country (that has been revealed so far) if that could better help in some way.
